definition: to live one's life/to pass one's days/to get along
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: And her husband, and is XuJiaHui man living, is the child his dad.
sentences.chinese: 而徐嘉惠是丈夫，是過日子的人，是孩子他爹。

sentences.english: For years, Spindler survived mostly off savings from his consulting work.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，他主要依靠原先做諮詢工作時的積蓄過日子。

sentences.english: A lot of people live their lives having no clue what they want.
sentences.chinese: 很多人渾渾噩噩過日子，不清楚自己想要什麼。

sentences.english: The poor man at last was eased and hence lived happily.
sentences.chinese: 這個可憐的人終於安下心來，快快活活地過日子了。
達賴一貫靠說謊過日子。

sentences.english: Modelling was something that I got into because I just didn't want to wear a suit and tie for a living.
sentences.chinese: 咱可不想穿個西裝打個領帶擺各種姿勢過日子。

sentences.english: Out in the sticks? Don't be nuts.
sentences.chinese: 在那種不毛之地過日子？你別傻了。

sentences.english: People just want to get along with their work and their life, and don’t want to get bothered.
sentences.chinese: 人們只是想好好地過日子，不想被那些事擾亂生活。

sentences.english: Take him away and give me my monkey back. I can do without donkeys like him.
sentences.chinese: 把它牽走，把錢還給我，我沒有這樣的驢也能過日子。

sentences.english: When the food ran out we had to pull in our belt.
sentences.chinese: 沒有食物時，我們必須勒緊褲帶過日子。

sentences.english: The Tanglin Club is a bore she can do without.
sentences.chinese: 坦格林俱樂部討厭得很，她沒有它也能過日子。

sentences.english: Could not look like formerly such ignorant living again at least.
sentences.chinese: 至少不能再像從前那樣渾噩地過日子。

sentences.english: He that lives upon Hope, dies farting.
sentences.chinese: 凡靠希望過日子的人，將會絕糧而死。

sentences.english: Since the husband wallows in the net swims, she decides to let the husband swim with the net get along.
sentences.chinese: 既然丈夫沉溺網遊，她決定讓丈夫同網遊過日子。

sentences.english: You know that nine out of ten con-men end up spending empty bitter lives as chiropractors ?
sentences.chinese: 騙子的下場十有八九隻能靠按摩過日子。

definition: a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
to support a family/to raise a family
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
to live alone/to spend time alone (or with a significant other)
to live one's life/to make a living
